greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle in which row n contains the n smallest numbers starting from 1 and coprime to n.
comment: A247815 and A247892 give number of primes and nonprimes per row. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 26 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..125 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: row[n_] := Take[Select[Range[n^2], GCD[ #, n]==1&], n]; Join@@row/@Range[13]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 14 2002
